original: Lindstam, Ragnar Paulus Johan Mathias, kyrkoherde, Huskvarna, f. 22/1/84 i Berga, Kronob. k, av kyrkoh. Magnus L. o, Hildegard Walierström. G. 11 m. Hildur Johanson, d. 40. Barn: Fredrik f. 20. — Mog:ex. i Lund 04, teol. fil. ex. i Upps. 06, teol. kand. 09, prakt. teol. prov o. prästv. f. Växjö stift 10. V. pastor i Åker 11, vakanskommin. i Hakarp 18, kommin. i HuJtsjö 11, past:adj. i Jönköp. 19, ständ. adj. i Huskvarna 19, kyrkoh. där ■sed. 23. Brunnspred, i Loka 15, bad-pred. i Marstrand 20. Timlär. v. Huskvarna komm. meliansk. 18-31, vik. adj. v. Jönköp. h. a. 1. 25 o. 26. Statsstip. f. stud:resa t. TyskL, Ös-terr. o. Schweiz 21. Skr.: ett flert. krön., historiker o. upps. i kultur- o. släkthist. m. fl. ämnen. Hobby: filateli.
translated: Lindstam, Ragnar Paulus Johan Mathias, vicar, Huskvarna, b. 22/1/84 in Berga, Crown Province, son of vicar Magnus L. and Hildegard Walierström. Married 11 March with Hildur Johanson, died in 1940. Children: Fredrik b. 1920. Graduated from Lund in 1904, Bachelor of Theology from Uppsala in 1906, Theology Candidate in 1909, passed practical theology examination and ordained as a priest in Växjö Diocese in 1910. Became a pastor in Åker in 1911, temporary curate in Hakarp in 1918, curate in Hultsjö in 1911, assistant pastor in Jönköping in 1919, permanent assistant pastor in Huskvarna in 1919, and vicar there since 1923. Spa preacher in Loka in 1915, bath preacher in Marstrand in 1920. Part-time teacher in Huskvarna municipality for religious studies from 1918-1931, substitute assistant vicar in Jönköping on several occasions in 1925 and 1926. Received a government grant for a study trip to Germany, Austria, and Switzerland in 1921. Wrote several books, historical studies, and essays on cultural and genealogical history. Hobby: philately.

structured.name: Ragnar Paulus Johan Mathias Lindstam
structured.description: Vicar in Huskvarna. Son of vicar Magnus L. and Hildegard Walierström.
